summary: Netflix's soaring stock price means it is likely to split its stock soon . Netflix's earnings are soaring and it still has a long runway to grow . With the shares approaching $1,200, it is just about time for Netflix to split again in 2025 .  Revenue has climbed to more than $40 billion during the past 12 months compared to less than $10 billion 10 years ago . At the end of 2024, Netflix had more than 300 million global paid streaming memberships . There is plenty of room for streaming video to disrupt linear video in the years to come .  There is still a lot of room for Netflix to expand, especially outside of the U.S. In Asia, the company had fewer than 60 million subscribers at the end of 2024 . Netflix is aiming to increase revenue by adding new content and monetization techniques .  Netflix will split its stock again in 2025 . The last time it did so was in 2015 . A stock split does not change anything about Netflix's underlying business . All it would do is separate the Netflix pie into smaller pieces .  Netflix has a market cap of about $500 billion, and a price-to-earnings ratio (P/E) of 56. This is not cheap, even for a steady growth stock like Netflix . Regardless of whether Netflix is going to split its stock in 2025, this is an expensive stock that is probably not a buy today . Netflix's management reportedly believes it can double revenue and triple operating income by 2030 . The company is increasing prices and building out its advertising service . Management does not think the growth party is over just yet .  Video streaming processed through the cloud has turned the media sector into a truly worldwide game . Netflix has taken advantage of this global pie, investing to produce video specifically in markets such as Europe, Latin America, South Korea, and India .  By 2030, Netflix wants its advertising tier to generate around $9 billion in global ad sales . This advertising tier was launched in 2023 and is a huge driver of new sign-ups for Netflix . Free cash flow is now positive at $7.5 billion over the last 12 months .  Netflix aims to double its revenue to $80 billion in 2030 and triple its operating income to around $30 billion . Advertising revenue of $9 billion will be a large part of that equation . It hopes to grow its total subscribers to 410 million compared to 300 million at the end of 2024 .  Netflix has consistently pushed up its operating margin in the last 10 years . Expanding operating margins is not something a company can do indefinitely . The company can keep expanding its profit margins as it scales up to greater heights .  Netflix is a strong buy today .
